intro: Psychotria wauensis, commonly known as the Wau psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to the rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its morphological features and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
